reviews.text: This house is a short stroll from Passeig de Gracia and is thus exempt from the tourist crowd. The facade is very colourful and decorative. It is open to the public on Saturdays.

The building was designed in 1889 by Josep Domenech i Estapa and finished by Lluis Domenech i Montaner, the owner’s nephew. This beautiful modernist building has a touch of Italian renaissance and the most notable part is the top of the house which is decorated with large mosaics presenting the invention of the printing press.

Only open on Sat mornings for a guided English tour but well worth doing, maybe on the same day as Muntaner's masterpiece-the Catalan music hall in St Pere, nearby. Not every modernist masterpiece in Barcelona is by Gaudi and you should compare and contrast other great modernist architects from the same period. This is a fantastic building and there is nothing better than an informed guide taking around a small group.
